Few people want to recognize or admit that the majority of the "victims" were victims simply because they failed to get out of the way of the massive Cat. 5 storm bearing down on the city. Now I'm no weather man, but if you tell me a Cat. 5 storm is coming towards my house, I'm leaving. I don't care if I have to walk, I'm leaving. Now granted, there were true victims in NO who could not get out on their own, and my heart goes out to them. But probably more than 90% of the people that had to be rescued of the roof of their homes, or marched through the water to trash the superdome were more than capable of getting out on their own. They however found it more prudent to attempt to ride the storm out in their homes (below sea level in a city surrounded by water).
